Title: Social Media Content Creator + Style Advisor (Chinook) - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
OAK + FORT is a fashion and lifestyle brand that provides attainable luxuries consisting of modern essentials in full collections of womenswear, menswear, accessories, jewelry and homeware.
Our first stores opened in Vancouver, BC in 2010. Today, OAK + FORT has expanded across Canada and the US with over 20 stores throughout North America.
POSITION SUMMARY
An ambitious and like-minded individual who has a strong interest in fashion and social media. Your role will be 80% in store as a Style Advisor and 20% in store creating content & posting on your own social platforms. As the Social Media Content Creator for your store location, you have the opportunity to create content for your own social media accounts while assisting in building OAK + FORT’s presence in the digital space. In addition, as a Style Advisor, you will be an integral part of your in-store sales team, creating exceptional experience for our retail clients through sales generation, staff development & store functionality.
All interested applicants must share links to your social media accounts for reference. Instagram and TikTok links are a requirement, but you are also welcomed to share links to your YouTube, Twitter, Pinterest, blog, etc. if you have them. Your social media accounts will serve as a portfolio for your application, demonstrating your passion, creativity and experience in creating fashion related social media content. This is a part-time position. Candidates must be available to work 20 hours per week.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Social Media Content Creator
Develop visually compelling, relevant, and product focused sales driving content for your own social media platforms that is engaging for the target audience.
Monitor and submit analytics weekly after posting, identifying areas of success and areas of improvement.
Drive Sales through your custom UTM Link
Post compelling content across your multiple social media accounts, with a focus on Instagram and TikTok, utilizing unique captions, trending hashtags and other methods that attract engagement and discoverability.
Be constantly learning and staying up to date on the latest social media app updates. Willing to use and learn new emerging platforms. You will also be able to take part in social media, marketing & styling workshops.
Engage with prospective customers in your comment sections and your DMs. Gather your audience’s feedback to ascertain their insights.
Utilize social media best practices, including but not limited to implementing a well-researched hashtag strategy for your posts.
Adhere to the Marketing Calendar, creating imagery and video well in advance of the scheduled post-date. Be prepared to accept spur-of-the-moment assignments to quickly capture short-term trending concepts.
Remain open to constructive feedback that may require adjusting content aesthetic, layouts, storyboards, pitches or pre-created content.
Style Advisor
Seriously impact sales through application of OAK + FORT sales culture.
Meet the minimum sales requirement In-Store
Be obsessed with creating world-class experiences for our clients.
Form real, lasting connections with your clients and co-workers.
Be a brand ambassador by keeping up with new arrivals, product knowledge, and wearing current merchandise.
Share your deep knowledge about the OAK + FORT brand with genuine enthusiasm.
Build our team by welcoming and supporting the onboarding of new employees.
Build relationships with your store team, peers and relevant partners.
Champion the operational systems in place to ensure our stores function effectively.
Champion proper presentation of merchandise in accordance with corporate directives.
Efficiently and accurately support with shipping and receiving of merchandise.
Champion stock room organization.
Support cleanliness and maintenance of physical store to create a safe and comfortable shopping experience.
Adhere to loss prevention policies to prevent external and internal theft.
Process cash desk operations with engagement, efficiency and accuracy.
Work hard but have fun!
REQUIREMENTS
A passion and interest in fashion and social media is a must!
A strong understanding of fashion and an ability to style outfits while incorporating new trends.
A good understanding of OAK + FORT, a connection to our aesthetic and the ability to share it with others.
Strong communication skills both verbal and written.
Knowledge in the social media landscape is essential. You stay up to date on the latest trends, love editing images and videos using various apps on your phone, enjoy curating a cohesive feed, strive to engage and build your social media following. You aspire to be a social media influencer.
Ability to communicate with an external audience, representing OAK + FORT as a brand ambassador in a polished manner.
Exceptional time management skills, including the ability to prioritize, manage and meet deadlines.
Results driven, energetic, resourceful and proactive with superior interpersonal skills. You should be a natural self-starter, hardworking and ambitious.
An outgoing personality. A passion for providing exceptional customer service.
Previous experience and a good understanding of Instagram and TikTok analytics is an asset.
An interest in marketing is an asset.
Experience working in the fashion retail industry is an asset.

Title: Bilingual Content Creator - Remote - Indeed.com
Social Media and Communications - Contractor - Colwood, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
GableCraft Homes is looking for a creative and dynamic
Social Media and Communications Contractor
to work with our passionate, industry leading team in Victoria B.C. If you’re looking for an innovative company that’s focused on growth and is on a mission to create an unforgettable customer experience, please read on.
To be eligible for this opportunity, you must be able to submit an invoice, as either a contractor, sole proprietorship, or company.
The Role
Working for Sales and Marketing Manager, this role is accountable for planning, implementing, and monitoring, social media activities to help elevate the brands of Royal Bay Community and GableCraft Homes, as well as coordination and execution of blogs and newsletters. The Social Media & Communications Contractor will be integral to driving results through content creation and brand positioning.
This role is best suited for a self-starter with a positive, vibrant personality who enjoys the hustle and bustle found within the day-to-day operations of a dynamic work environment. This position is ideal for someone who wants to roll up their sleeves and wants to be a part of GableCraft’s continuing development, growth and success.
The Responsibilities
Work with GableCraft’s marketing team to strategize quarterly social and blog content plans and then execute them.
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop unique selling propositions, product positioning and messaging that resonates with our target buyers and ensure it is being delivered online in a compelling way that is aligned with our business goals and brand.
Providing support for online communications including coverage of live community events, sponsorships, construction updates, open houses, product launches, sales events, and progress on commercial developments.
Write and schedule all social media content with a focus on SEO, including the organization of professional photography and video for grid and reels, etc.
Monitor, respond and potentially escalate interactions on social media platforms.
Continuous monitoring of social media analytics with monthly reports delivered to the marketing team.
Stay up to date on the latest social media trends and features.
Now Let’s Talk About You
You have experience executing and evaluating marketing strategies on social media platforms, including Facebook and Instagram.
You possess strong copywriting and customer service skills
You thrive both working alone and working within a highly efficient team
You can prioritize and manage multiple projects at once
You are a creative and flexible individual with a strong eye for detail
Our ‘Must Haves’
Marketing, Social Media or Communications diploma with 2-5 years in a social media or communications role
Supplementary training: WordPress, HubSpot, Sprout Social
Comfortable with editing software, such as Photoshop
High level of Social Media competency
Valid Driver’s License with reliable transportation
Royal Bay is a Seaside Master-Planned Community Development located in Colwood, B.C. Planned for several thousand new homes with additional commercial and retail amenities, Royal Bay is a unique and exciting new development on the WestShore. GableCraft Homes is continuing to grow rapidly, building over 100 homes per year, and this is an opportunity to work with a locally based team with a larger corporate relationship.
We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in contracting with GableCraft Homes, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent
Salary: $50,000.00-$60,000.00 per year
Application question(s):
Do you understand that this is a contract position and you must be able to submit an invoice to be paid?
Can you work for at 3 days a week in the office in Colwood?
Experience:
Social Media Marketing: 1 year (preferred)
Work remotely:
Yes

Title: Digital Marketing Manager (PPC Expert) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Us
Adcore (TSX:ADCO) is an industry-leading tech agency providing various solutions for outstanding digital marketing. Hand in hand with our technology, we offer a comprehensive service specialized in paid marketing models.
Our vision is to create effortless marketing for any entity that seeks to promote a product, business, or activity. Therefore, we set ourselves a mission to develop the most innovative and advanced solutions in order to achieve a state of effortless advertising for our clients.
Our modern open concept office is located in the heart of Toronto (Richmond St W & Duncan St). Annual trips abroad (when COVID will allow) and Google accreditation education are just some of the perks you will experience from working at Adcore
About the Role
We are seeking an enthusiastic Sr. Digital Advertising Manager to join our growing Elite team in Toronto. You will be managing our clients’ digital marketing activity, building and implementing marketing strategies, and optimizing towards the clients’ business goals and KPIs.
If you are motivated, have the right attitude with a willingness to learn in an agile office where your voice will make a huge difference, we want to hear from you!
What You'll Be Doing
Manage Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and PPC projects including client relations, performance analysis, campaign development, testing & reporting
Research and analyze industry changes/developments in Search Engine Marketing
Analyze client websites and provide well-defined strategies to improve site performance and ROI
Create and present written recommendations for SEM performance improvements
Perform analysis and research, provide recommendations, and develop strategy for PPC campaigns
Manage day-to-day client relationships with clients around North America
Coach and train junior and medior Digital Advertising Managers
What We’re Looking For
Top candidates will have multichannel experience (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Microsoft Ads, etc.)
Strong aptitude in technology/data analysis
Highly motivated, goal driven with a willingness to have fun and learn along the way with a team to support you
Ability to think creatively and work independently
Strong analytical skills and ability to draw conclusions and determine strategies based on data
Passionate about the digital marketing industry and willing to keep up with the latest Google and Social trends
Customer service orientation and ability to form lasting customer relationships
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in-person and through video conferencing
Strong organizational skills, time management and attention to detail
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and tasks simultaneously
Minimum of 4 years of relevant working experience
A degree in marketing, communications, IT or relevant field is preferred
Additional Information
Salary + Commission
Working Hours: Monday-Friday
Laptop and hardware provided
Work remotely during COVID
International career opportunities
And much more including a great team-centered culture
Application
Please attach your CV in English along with your application. Applications without a CV will not be considered
We thank all individuals for their applications. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from all qualified individuals and specifically applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups – including Indigenous persons, newcomers, and persons with disabilities – who may contribute to the continued diversification of our organization.

Title: Digital Marketing - Personalization Lead - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Address:
55 Bloor Street West
Job Family Group:
Marketing
BMO is a Canadian leader in Personalization. We’ve invested in the tools, the people, and the culture to become the best in delivering digital experiences that are delightful, compelling and personalized. Our Personalization Team continues to grow, and with this, we’re looking for a passionate strategy lead to help us reach the next level.
The Personalization Lead is responsible delivering Personalization and Web Experimentation for the Online Investing portfolio, specifically: personalization and optimization strategy, initiative coordination and delivery, relationship/stakeholder management, and analysis/research/reporting
A proven ability to lead and influence
Experienced in Personalization, Conversion Optimization, UX Strategy, or Digital Analytics
Proficient with web experimentation and statistical concepts (e.g. statistical significance, Multivariate testing, etc.)
Excel at finding insights in data, and creative solutions to problems – you pride yourself on being a critical thinker and a self-starter who finds new opportunities in your work
Innovative thinker with a passion for creating optimization ideas, nurturing a test & learn culture to improve business performance
Comfort with defining experimentation and personalization strategies based on business objectives, lead with a hypothesis and translate them into actionable tests & implementation plans
Are passionate about creating exceptional user experiences that drive value for our customers
Are highly personable and collaborative in nature – we’re looking for a true team player!
A solid understanding of how web technologies work
A solid understanding of UX and digital analytics
Qualifications
4+ years working experience in Digital, UX, Product Management, Digital Analytics, Business
Analysis or related fields
Or 3+ years working with Personalization, Conversion Optimization, or A/B/multivariate testing practices and technologies
Excellent knowledge of experimentation, targeting, best practice and trends for digital optimization
Solid understanding of user research methods: qualitative and quantitative
Solid understanding of web analytics
Excellent knowledge of web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, or similar)
Excellent knowledge of AB testing technologies (Adobe Target, Optimizely, Oracle Maxymiser, or similar)
Excellent knowledge of agile development cycle and tools (Jira, Rally or similar)
Advanced MS Excel experience
Strong relationship-management and motivational skills: Establish productive working relationships with internal clients, external vendors and stakeholders, and to convince internal customers to adopt new approaches
Ability to advise a cross-functional team of developers, analysts, and business stakeholders through ideation, prioritization, implementation, and reporting
Ability to present to large audiences in a clear and concise manner
Developed consulting / marketing skills involving networking and advocating of the benefits of the team throughout the organization
Excellent communication (written and oral) skills
Excellent data visualization knowledge and skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Financial Services industry experience an asset, but not required
Key Accountabilities
Personalization and Optimization Strategy
Understand overall business objectives and identify personalization or A/B/multivariate testing opportunities
Build and own Personalization strategy for LOB, including calendar, prioritization, roadmap, audience and optimization strategy
Gain buy-in and alignment for LOB Personalization Strategy
Provide digital expertise and identify opportunities to deliver increase traffic, engagement, conversion to increase sales performance
Form hypotheses about what digital experiences will resonate with customers
Project Management and Delivery
Coordinate between multifunctional teams to deliver on a digital initiative (digital, product, marketing, experience design, UX research, development, QA, analytics, and implementation teams); including crafting tickets (user stories) and managing them through execution
Provide ongoing guidance and coordination to the run team
Help define, document, and enforce the personalization and testing process
Run UAT and launch initiatives
Lead in executing digital optimization and personalization efforts via Adobe Target and Adobe Audience Manager (A/B testing, multivariate testing, behavioural targeting, and segment-based targeting)
Relationship Management, Change Management
Foster strong working-relationships with stakeholders, effectively managing expectations, and keeping projects on-schedule and within scope
Mentor and coach stakeholders on personalization work and tool usage
Act as a Subject Matter Expert for personalization and experimentation
Analysis, Researching, and Reporting
Use a variety of research techniques to inform personalization initiatives: competitive analysis, web analytics, customer analytics, advertising analytics, surveys, usability evaluations, past initiatives, market trends, etc.
Provide regular status updates
Analyze and report on personalization initiatives using Adobe Analytics
Present and socialize findings (both successes and opportunities) with stakeholders to create an atmosphere of transparency and data-driven optimization
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Waterloo, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you fiercely creative and know how to get people talking? Are you driven to craft solutions and tell stories in unique and out-of-the-box ways?
At Durrell Communications we pursue excellence in being the voice of our clients, and we are looking for our newest creative team member! If you are a collaborative and meticulous individual with a passion for execution who is driven to optimize our clients’ position in print and online, then we encourage you to apply!
How you will make a difference
Reporting to the Manager of Strategic Communications, the Marketing Strategist drives online strategy, including the management, creation and distribution of content. They manage the digital voice of the client by creating content that increases a client’s sales, revenue, brand awareness and reputation. They set and measure the strategic goals and performance metrics for each client.
What you will be doing
Marketing Strategy:
Develop and implement both short- and long-term online marketing strategies that intertwine various techniques which will consistently meet or exceed planned objectives.
Execute the digital strategy including social media, SEO, SEM, mobile marketing, email-marketing, online banners, digital content, online marketing campaigns, Facebook Ads, Google Ads and target audience initiatives.
Use customer behaviour, insights and prior campaign results to develop new marketing strategies, assist clients in determining who their target marketing group, and implement the best strategies for targeting this group.
Develop pay-per-click marketing strategies for clients, specifically using Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads (search and display) and other platforms.
Create and update content calendars for each client that addresses their individual goals and objectives.
Write the digital strategy for media packages in collaboration with the Media Strategist.
Content Creation:
Create content in collaboration with Coordinators and Content Assistants that is consistent and appropriately reflects client brand and standards and ensures that content is optimized for third-party search engines and tools.
Create and execute a social media engagement strategy in collaboration with other client team members, and actively engage with the online audience.
Procure or create jpegs, pdfs, videos, art, graphs, charts, thumbnail images and other design elements for social media content.
Metrics & Analytics:
Set KPIs and monitor the effectiveness of each implemented client strategy on a monthly basis and course correct to ensure strategy objectives are met.
Provide monthly reporting to the leadership team that analyzes each client’s statistics and provides recommendations.
What we require
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Public Relations, English, Journalism, Communication or another related field
Integrated marketing technology certificate
1+ experience in social media management or digital marketing role
Software Skills: ASANA, Agility PR, Canva, Photoshop, InDesign, Publisher, Sprout Social, WordPress, Hubspot, Google Ads, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads Manager, Facebook Business Suite, Instagram Reels, Mailchimp or other email marketing platforms
Skills for success
A passion for digital marketing and social advertising with a drive to discover what’s trending.
Exceptional project management skills including organizational, strategic, planning and implementation skills.
Must be able to meet tight deadlines and execute flawlessly on projects in a fast-paced environment and see a project through to completion.
Experience managing paid campaigns through Facebook Ads Manager.
Familiarity with Google Analytics, Google Adwords Editor and Adwords scripts as well as using/implementing Google Tag Manager.
Develops content for newsletters, e-blasts or e-promotional emails, managing subscriber lists, formatting and distribution
High degree of integrity, confidentiality and accountability.
Strong working knowledge of communication principles and practises.
Advanced verbal and written English language skills.
Why Durrell Communications?
As a full-service public relations agency, we work with our clients to promote their brand in print and online.
Durrell Communications gives you the opportunity to grow your career alongside our talented team of communication specialists, media strategists, marketing strategists and public relations professionals developing global media campaigns and arranging memorable events.
Refine your craft alongside the best in the industry and within an engaging and community-focused workplace.
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require a specific accommodation, please let us know.
If this sounds like you, apply today!
Application deadline: 2021-11-26
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
Profit sharing
Vision care
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Title: Digital Marketer - Edmundston, NB - Indeed.com
Description:
Digital Marketing Associate
The
Grey Rock Casino
is a modern, state-of-the-art casino, bingo, and dining experience on the Madawaska Maliseet First Nation in New Brunswick. The Grey Rock Casino is one of the many attractions located in the Grey Rock Power Center. Its name influenced by the grey rocks that can be found on the mountains surrounding the power center.
On arrival, you are welcomed with a 40-foot totem pole portraying the legendary Glooscap and his spirit friends. Inside, you’ll surely be inspired by the natural beauty of our traditional territory, the interior décor blends wood, stone, and earth tones to create an appealing gaming environment. Enjoy a fun-filled evening then stay the night at the Quality Hotel; just walk straight through the enclosed pedway and take the elevator to bed!
We offer a variety of dining options; the Fiddlehead café is on the main floor serving tasty breakfasts and your casual dining favourites. Named in honour of Maliseet history, fiddleheads have adorned Maliseet Nation canoes, wigwams and clothing long before any written record. Our Casino bar lounge is also on the main floor and a hub for live music and lively conversation.
On the second floor, the Valley View Restaurant offers an upscale steakhouse experience showcasing some of the best ingredients in our region. Enjoy the views from the mezzanine; look down on the gaming floor and be dazzled by our elegant, twinkling custom-made chain chandeliers. A landscape of the Bay of Fundy, one of the seven natural wonders of North America, watches over the floor from eye-view level.
The casino also hosts an event center of 10,000 square feet where conferences, weddings, and concerts can be enjoyed.
The Digital Marketing Associate is responsible to acquire new traffic through the use of online digital media. While working towards achieving company objectives, the Marketing Team's role is to build strong community relationships, enhance the casinos image and create brand awareness.
The Digital Marketing Associate is responsible for
Manage and maintain company social media accounts, website, and email promotions
Create graphics and video content through the use of Adobe for promotions, social media, menus, etc
Work with the different departments to promote success thru the use of marketing on different channels and creative strategies
Create monthly promotions on the marketing kiosk
Attend trade shows
Participate in creative meetings and other meetings to brainstorm ideas
Creatively contribute to the team environment and culture
Other duties as reasonable and assigned
Experience & Qualifications Required:
Must be 19 years or over
Post-secondary education in Marketing, Business Management, Commerce or an equivalent combination of education and experience
A good head for business development
Strong organizational skills
Team-working skills
Strong Creative ability
The energy and enthusiasm to deal with campaigns
The ability to work to deadlines and cope with the consequent pressure
Expert level Fluency in ENGLISH and FRENCH (written and spoken)
Ability to work effectively with large number of clients and providers
Application deadline: 2021-12-20
Expected start date: 2022-01-10
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Casual dress
Company events
Dental care
Disability insurance
Discounted or free food
Extended health care
On-site parking
Paid time off
Vision care
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (preferred)
Experience:
Marketing / Graphic Design: 1 year (preferred)
Language:
English and French (preferred)

No

Title: Marketing Manager - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you our new Marketing Manager?
Lucent Biosciences is on a mission to develop solutions to mitigate the climate impact on global food security and nutrition. We have developed the first carbon-neutral, sustainable, non-polluting agricultural micronutrient fertilizer called Soileos.
We are looking for a Marketing Manager who can build our brand and is looking to make an impact on regenerative agriculture.
You like to spend your time:
Working from home or from our Vancouver and Coquitlam offices collaborating with the Chief Executive Officer, product management and business development team on marketing strategies and occasionally traveling to events in North America as needed.
Developing and implementing our company brand and messaging
Providing guidance, input, and feedback on the creative direction and briefs of all Marketing assets, including trade show/conference materials, website (including input on SEO/SEM strategy and results), landing pages, print or digital advertisements, etc to meet strategic goals, ensure effectiveness and cohesiveness, and increase brand awareness.
Owning the entire process of generating demand to meet and exceed revenue targets by researching, designing, executing, testing, tweaking, and measuring high ROI multi-channel digital marketing campaigns and initiatives across the prospect and customer lifecycle, ensuring the alignment of communications and messaging to generate top-of-funnel leads, drive traffic, and nurture opportunities to conversion for our business development teams, using SEO, content marketing, social media, email, nurture campaigns, webinars, online promotions, landing pages, etc.
Organizing, administering, and optimizing our CRM (HubSpot) and other Marketing/Sales tools for solid integration and automation.
Providing input on annual Marketing budget, tracking various marketing and sales KPIs such as conversion rates, ROI, CAC, etc, preparing monthly reports, identifying effectiveness or opportunities for improvement and making data-backed decisions to optimize accordingly.
Complete ownership of researching, identifying, and project managing events such as conferences or trade shows, including managing budgets, vendor selection and management, contract negotiations, purchasing and shipping any materials (such as furniture, booths, etc), ordering swag and assets, booking travel, and any other deadlines or deliverables.
Leading debriefs and strategy post-conference, ensuring any leads enter the funnel or nurture campaigns, helping sales team to execute, and measuring event-specific KPIs.
Collaborating with Product Management and Business Development teams to build and nurture key relationships with customers, partners, and key industry players to gain insights about prospect and customer journeys and conceptualize and execute any customer or partner marketing initiatives, product launches, or outreach campaigns.
Your Experience & Skills:
6+ years in a Demand Generation, Digital Marketing, or Marketing Manager role for a B2B company
3+ years managing a team of 2+ marketing team members
Deep understanding of prospect, buyer, and customer journeys, as well as buyer personas, and how to market to each stage and type
Strong writing skills
Expert level user in various Marketing tools, such as CRMs, SEO, Google Analytics, etc.
Comfortable working with numbers, making sense of metrics and processing figures with spreadsheets
Easily balance independent ownership of projects with collaborative team mindset
Proactive, strategic, detail-oriented, data-backed
Meeting deadlines under pressure, prioritizing multiple tasks, and communicating effectively
Multilingual abilities are a pre but not required.
Your Area of Expertise:
Direct and Digital B2B marketing
Brand messaging development and implementation
Sales funnel management through a CRM (we use HubSpot)
Customer acquisition, re-engagement, and retention strategies
Interpreting data, measuring KPIs, and forecasting trends
Conference/trade show detail planning, coordination & execution
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in digital marketing and measurement
Remuneration will be commensurate with experience.
COVID PROTOCOLS - Lucent Bio cares about the health of its employees and requires proof of full vaccination to be considered for this position.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Winnipeg, MB - Indeed.com
Description:
JOB CODE : 17fmtl-97374
DESCRIPTION :
Do you consider your role as a digital marketer to be a strategic business thinker as much as someone who delivers market qualified leads through paid search? Do you thrive on solving intellectually stimulating problems with constant iteration, experimentation, and campaign optimization? If you're looking for an aggressive marketing challenge within a SaaS company with a large portfolio of products, this role is for you.
This role will work across stakeholder groups to define and implement our digital lead generation strategy via PPC, SEO, social media, and paid search marketing campaigns. The Digital Marketing Specialist will lead numerous campaigns across different platforms and should consider themselves sophisticated and experienced in a variety of digital marketing automation tools, CRMs, and social media automation tools.

This position will need to continually leverage data to identify opportunities to improve performance, reach, and return on investment of digital marketing activities.

5+ years experience in B2B SaaS digital marketing and advertising
Experience managing PPC, SEM and affiliate programs
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics and Adwords
Expertise in creating and optimizing large B2B SaaS paid advertising campaigns
Expertise with a range of digital marketing automation tools (HubSpot Pardot, Marketo), CRM tools (SFDC), and social media automation tools (Buffer, Postplanner, Aweber, Hootsuite)
Achieve larger business growth goals through Developing and managing digital marketing campaigns
Devising strategies to increase online traffic to the company website and landing pages
Comfort operating with multiple products within a portfolio of SaaS products
Team player with strong skills in the areas of leadership, motivation, relationship building, and communications
Savvy leader with exceptional bandwidth who can navigate a high growth, rapidly changing organization

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company description
LOYAL BRANDING is a marketing agency start-up focusing story brand for businesses to clarify their messages, so their customers engage with them more. In addition, we offer full marketing services, such as marketing plan creation, website design, video creation, content marketing, SEO optimization and social media channels management based on brand story platform. The company is growing so fast as more businesses understand the value of story for their marketing. Our ultimate goal is to help our clients get higher ROI by implementing effective marketing strategy.
Job description
Who we are:
Loyal Branding is a marketing agency start-up focusing on brand story for businesses to clarify their messages, so their customers engage with them more. We offer full marketing services, such as marketing plan creation, website design, video creation, content marketing, SEO optimization and social media channels management based on brand story platform. The company is growing so fast as more businesses understand the value of story for their marketing. Our ultimate goal is to help our clients get higher ROI by implementing effective marketing strategy.
Business Overview:
Reporting to Marketing Manager, the digital marketing specialist supports the team with the creation and distribution of marketing content across multiple platforms for our clients to drive sales, increase engagement and promote their brands.
What you will do:
· Will help to apply story brand to marketing strategies and campaigns through various online channels for our clients
· Will Create written content for web, customer-facing emails, blogs and social media post
· Will Employ SEO-driven content strategy across all web-based communications
· Will meet with our customers to find their marketing needs and implement related strategies into all marketing materials
· Will monitor and report on the performance of website and social media content of our clients
· Will make advertisements videos for our clients based on their needs.
Qualification
· University degree, minimum 3-5 years of digital marketing experience
· A proven track record in using SEO, Mail Chimp and deep knowledge of current Google approach
· A proven track record in managing social media including AdWords etc.
· Familiarity with data measurements, competitor analysis and other relevant tools (Google Analytics, SEM, etc.)
· Demonstrated ability to manage work successfully with a rapidly changing environment

About KOTRA (Consulate General of the Republic of Korea, Commercial Section)
KOTRA (Korea Trade and Investment Promotion Agency) - established in 1962, is a state-funded trade and investment promotion organization operated by the Government of South Korea. KOTRA focuses on the globalization of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), the backbone of the Korean economy, by providing them with customized support related to global business establishment and export. Today, KOTRA has constructed a vast network of 127 Korea Business Centers (KBCs) in 84 countries and continues to be committed to promoting international trade and investment between Korea and the world.

Diversity, equity and inclusion are fundamental to our mission to educate students. We are committed to education that places strong emphasis on global citizenship, social justice and equity. We live this through the strength and richness that diversity brings to our workforce and welcome contributors from equity groups including: Visible Minorities, Persons with Disabilities, Lesbian Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Queer persons
We also recognize that Centennial is situated on the Treaty Lands of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and pay tribute to their legacy as well as that of all First Peoples that have been and remain present here in Toronto. We recognize that First Peoples come from sovereign Nations and that part of understanding our responsibilities of residing on this territory are understanding the true history, circumstances and legacy of the Treaties signed here (such as the Toronto Purchase, Robinson-Huron Treaty and Williams Treaties) and including pre-contact Treaties and Agreements between sovereign Nations and that all peoples in this area are therefore Treaty people with obligations and responsibilities to all our relations.
Position Summary
Reporting to the Recruitment Manager, International Digital Engagement, this position plays a strategic role in the virtual recruitment of international students within Canada and worldwide using interactive digital media. The incumbent is also responsible for identifying, implementing, and monitoring a range of digital, multi-media, and social media tools for the purpose of recruiting international students to Centennial College programs in accordance with standard established admission requirements. The incumbent is required to work collaboratively as part of the Admissions team and must have extensive knowledge of College programs and education systems in geographic regions and their equivalencies to the Canadian Education System.
Responsibilities
Provides accurate information in responding to a wide variety of general and detailed information requests regarding programs, credentials, admissions requirements, student services, as well as the benefits of studying and working in Canada.
Coordinates digital engagement activities, webinars, livestreams, and email marketing campaigns that influence prospective international students throughout their planning, decision-making, and enrolment journey.
Monitors, maintains, and continuously validates completeness, accuracy, and security of data that is posted to Banner or uploaded electronically to ensure its integrity and accuracy.
Investigates and identifies areas needing further investigation and/or corrections in accordance with the student's selected program of study. Identifies specific Banner data report requirements. Reviews reports, investigates and verifies the accuracy of records.
Supports Lead Generation, Customer Engagement, and Measurement of Digital Recruitment activities.
Supports Content Strategy by writing and editing communications for email, social media, and online publications, working collaboratively with other departments and schools to source content, testimonials, and guest speakers.
Generates student prospects from various lead sources, including virtual fairs, partner websites, social media, and multi-media advertising campaigns. Execute follow-ups, lead nurture campaigns, and report on the impact of digital recruitment initiatives.
Develops and executes the different components of customer segmentation and journey mapping strategies by utilizing Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and digital information management tools such as Salesforce, Akero, ConstantContact, Form Assembly, Sync Apps, and Microsoft Excel.
Responsible for creating technology-driven solutions and troubleshooting technical, logistic, and strategic challenges. Scale successful initiatives and incorporate the most cutting-edge technology to support global recruitment plans.
Collaborates with domestic recruitment and College marketing teams to: achieve a unified approach to recruitment and develop a communications strategy that tells our story well, builds trust, and motivates meaningful engagement to support our Vision, Mission, and institutional goals.
Focuses on technology innovation to enhance the student experience; Improves front-facing student support via social media, email, live chat, and instant messaging.
Keeps abreast of emerging digital, interactive, multi-media, and online recruitment tools, databases, and websites used for recruitment, admission, registration, and explores technology trends with the potential to enhance on-campus and virtual services to international students (e.g., Student Information Systems (SIS), Ontario Colleges Application Services (OCAS), Canadian Immigration Centre, the Library of Foreign Credential Assessment, etc.).
Works independently and collaboratively while taking the initiative to maintain their responsibilities in a multi-faceted environment.
Occasional local and international travel for recruitment events, presentations, multi-media productions, and conferences
Qualifications/Experience
A (3) three year community college diploma/degree or equivalent in Communications, Business, or Public Relations, including courses related to digital media, social media communications, new media, information and communication technologies, online and mobile advertising, and/or digital engagement strategy.
Minimum (3) three years of demonstrated experience in the following areas:
o Organization and project management
o Planning, delivery, and support of large-scale online events
o Digital recruitment and/or sales
o Digital media with a focus on interactive, multi-media, and social media marketing.
o Customer service and Marketing
Related practical experience, preferably in an international office or post-secondary recruitment or marketing role.
Demonstrated fluency in writing and speaking in English. Fluency in other languages are an asset.
Demonstrated experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and digital information management tools (i.e. Salesforce, Akero, ConstantContact, Form Assembly, Sync Apps, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of PC software and of integrated student information database systems (e.g., Student Information Systems, Windows, Microsoft Word, Excel, Internet, and College Websites).
Demonstrated cross-cultural customer service experience responding to a wide variety of student concerns.
Experience utilizing complaint de-escalation and resolution techniques, active listening, and problem-solving in collaboration with internal and external contacts.
Strong computer skills with proven ability to work in a fast-paced customer service environment;
Demonstrated knowledge of related visa/immigration legislation
Comprehensive understanding of Canada's Anti-Spam Legislation (CASL) and Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA), as well as applicable international legislation such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for data subjects in the European Union.
Demonstrated ability to monitor, implement and regulate communication procedures to ensure compliance in all lead management procedures.
Apply online: www.centennialcollege.ca/careers
Proof of credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their foreign equivalents will be required at the time of job offer.
